textBox.richText: This morning is overcast and chilly. It rained last night, the ground is spongy, saturated with water. The weather suits our collective mood. Just as we’re not certain if there will be another electrical storm or bright sunshine within the hour, our excitement about the move is clouded with anxiety over the big unknowns: the drive across the county, our new lives out west. A pause for wry amusement: Willie has learned to pose for photographs. With the camera held in shooting position, I call his name. Willie looks at me and freezes until he hears the click of the shutter. Most of the time he waits to hear “good dog” before he moves from his spot. Gotta love him.
